title: New Trek Line Grips Have Less Plastic, More Rubber
content:
Trek is updating their “Line” lock-on grips with a focus on comfort. The new Trek Line grips feature a plastic core that’s cut out in strategic patches to maximize the amount of rubber between your hand and the bar…

The grips are made from 80% recycled material, including an especially soft rubber compound. The grips are left/right specific, and the tread is optimized for better damping at the palm and better grip at the fingers. The grip diameter is approximately 31 mm. They’re not thin, they’re not thick, so maybe they’re just right?

There are five versions of the updated Line Grips. The Line Pro is held on with two alloy clamps, the Line Elite uses a single alloy clamp, and the Line Comp uses a single composite clamp. But there are also new Ergonomic grips, with an Ergon-style built-in wing. These are available in the single-composite-clamp Comp version and a dual-alloy-clamp Pro version.
